info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SOMERSET AND SOUTHWESTERN CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Latrobe to 17 miles southeast of Greensburg to 12 miles northwest of Somerset to near Connellsville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts from the west up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boswell and Acosta around 235 PM EDT. New Centerville and Jerome around 240 PM EDT. Westmont, Southmont and Friedens around 245 PM EDT. Belmont, Johnstown and Somerset around 250 PM EDT. Windber, Central City and Scalp Level around 255 PM EDT. Salix-Beauty Line Park, Sidman and Berlin around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Benson, Elim, Stoystown, Indian Lake and Seven Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
